script.text: Service conditions, Normal service conditions: Residual voltage at energization This shall not exceed 10 % of the rated voltage (see Clause 21, Subclause 19.2 and Annex D).

Service conditions, Normal service conditions: Altitude If the altitude exceeds 1 000 m above sea level a correction factor shall be applied to all external insulation requirements as stipulated in Clause 18.
Service conditions, Normal service conditions: The capacitors number represents the lowest ambient air temperature at which the capacitor may operate.
Service conditions, Normal service conditions: The capacitors letters represent upper limits of temperature variation ranges, having maximum values specified in Table 1.
Service conditions, Normal service conditions: The capacitors temperature categories cover the temperature range of +50 °C to +55 °C.

Service conditions, Normal service conditions: The lowest ambient air temperature at which the capacitor may be operated should be chosen from the five preferred values: +5 °C, -5 °C, -25 °C, -40 °C, -50 °C.
Service conditions, Normal service conditions: If the capacitor influences the air temperature, the ventilation and/or choice of capacitor shall be such that the Table 1 limits are maintained.

Service conditions, Normal service conditions: If the capacitor influences the air temperature, then the cooling air temperature in such an installation shall not exceed the temperature limits of Table 1 by more than 5 °C.

Service conditions, Unusual service conditions: Unless otherwise agreed between manufacturer and purchaser, this standard does not apply to capacitors, the service conditions of which, in general, are incompatible with the requirements of the present standard.
Quality requirements and tests, General: Supporting insulators, switches, instrument transformers, external fuses, etc. shall be in accordance with relevant IEC standards.
Quality requirements and tests, Test conditions: Unless otherwise specified for a particular test or measurement, the temperature of the capacitor dielectric shall be in the range +5 °C to +35 °C.

Quality requirements and tests, Test conditions: When a correction has to be applied, the reference temperature to be used is +20 °C, unless otherwise agreed between the manufacturer and the purchaser.

Quality requirements and tests, Test conditions: The a.c. tests and measurements shall be carried out at a frequency of 50 Hz or 60 Hz independent of the rated frequency of the capacitor, if not otherwise specified.
Classification of tests, General, Routine tests: Measurement of the tangent of the loss angle (tan δ) of the capacitor (see Clause 8).
Classification of tests, General, Routine tests: Voltage test between terminals (see Clause 9).
Classification of tests, General, Routine tests: AC voltage test between terminals and container (see Clause 10).
Classification of tests, General, Routine tests: Test of internal discharge device (see Clause 11).
Classification of tests, General, Routine tests: Sealing test (see Clause 12).
Classification of tests, General, Routine tests: Discharge test on internal fuses (see 5.1.1 of IEC 60871-4:1996).
Classification of tests, General, Routine tests: Routine tests shall have been carried out by the manufacturer on every capacitor before delivery.
Classification of tests, General, Routine tests: If the purchaser so requests, he shall be supplied with a certificate detailing the results of such tests.
Classification of tests, General, Routine tests: The test sequence of type tests is not is not mandatory.
